revised_title: George Udny Yule: A Life in Statistics and Beyond
tldr: George Udny Yule was a prominent statistician and applied mathematician who made significant contributions to the field of statistics. He worked with Karl Pearson at University College London and later held a University Lectureship in Statistics at Cambridge. Yule also played a crucial role in the Royal Statistical Society and held various positions in other scientific societies. His interests extended beyond statistics, including literary pursuits, motoring, and flying. In his later years, he used statistical methods to investigate authorship controversies.
